bibl.title: Letter from Wade Hampton Frost to Laura Armistead Carter, February 12, 1930

div1.p: Frost sends material that Carter requested and updates her on progress on the final typing of the manuscript of the History of Yellow Fever.

div1.head: Letter from Wade Hampton Frost to Laura Armistead Carter, February 12, 1930
div1.opener:
Southern Med. Jour. Sept 1920
Carter's tribute to Gorgas (written July 5, 1920)
at Payta, Peru. S.A.)
THE JOHNS HOPKINS UNIVERSITY
SCHOOL OF HYGIENE AND PUBLIC HEALTH
615 NORTH WOLFE STREET
DEPARTMENT OF EPIDEMIOLOGY
BALTIMORE, MD.
February 12, 1930.
Miss Laura A. Carter,
2122 California Street, N.W.,
Washington, D.C.
My dear Miss Laura:
div1.p:
The material which you mention in your letter
of February 8th, which has just today been received,
is all available, but there is no necessity for you
to make a trip over here to get it, so I am sending
it to you by registered mail today.
What I am sending is as follows:

list.item:
(1) Section I, MS. used by Mrs. Smiley for
copying;

(2) Section I, third carbon of Mrs. Smiley's
copy of Section I;

(3) Section I, library cards referred to in
the Section;

(4) Your reference cards as referred to in the
text;

(6) Chapter 5 of Section III, MS. used by Mrs.
Smiley;

(7) Chapter 5 of Section III, third carbon of
Mrs. Smiley's copy.

div1.p:
I have not checked over Mrs. Smiley's copies and
though I know they are carefully made I presume there
may be some typographical errors here and there.

In the final editing of the clean copy of Section I,
it will be necessary here and there to insert a refer-
ence to a general note which I will write relative to
additional observations of importance in the epidemiology
of yellow fever which have been made since the manuscript
was written. Otherwise, I do not at this time know of
any changes that need to be made in the clean copy,
but will be grateful for any corrections or revisions
which you and Miss Brown may suggest.

The carbons of Mrs. Smiley's final copy are for you
to keep permanently, merely letting me know eventually
what changes and corrections have been made in them.
The rest of the material I may eventually need for re-
ference but I will not need any of it at all soon excepting ✓
the library cards and the typed list of them.

Susan and I are hoping to see you sometime this
month and I am sure that I will not need the library
cards or any other of the material until such time as
you may be coming over for other reasons.

Section II of the MS. seems to be about ready for
copying but beyond that I can make little progress this
trimester.
div1.closer:
With best regards,
Sincerely yours, W.H.F. whf/f
enclosures
Gorgas?
